title: Why pytorch does not accept input image as uint8 type
body_html:
🐛 Bug

I just may have a stupid question about fitting uint8 datatype into a CNN by pytorch. We know that a RGB image is often with a datatype of uint8. When I force to fit the original data into a CNN, it gave me error said that 'con2d does not accept the type of torch.ByteTensor'… So I have to transfer my image into float: omg.float.

The problem is that my data is MRI, when converting the image into float, the visualization results get strange… I do not know if this is because of the viewer or from pytorch… I check the value between different datatype, float or int8, the value did not change, (e.g., 144.0 to 144).

Thanks in advance for your help..

Hao
